channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 34

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Haha. I experienced that numerous times, so I completely empathize with the whole "feeling cheated" somehow. Such is what makes go so interesting though. Even though there are 99 ways to kill your opponent, if you happen to give them the 1 route to life, it can completely change the game. =D
item.content:encoded: Haha. I experienced that numerous times, so I completely empathize with the whole “feeling cheated” somehow. Such is what makes go so interesting though. Even though there are 99 ways to kill your opponent, if you happen to give them the 1 route to life, it can completely change the game. =D

item.title: By: Steven
item.dc:creator: Steven
item.description: Brilliant! :-) I remember one of my first games, "after" the game was played and all my territory was secure and I was clearly leading my opponent started to invade on the second line on the side. He created a number of false eyes but I didn't realise I could make them false permanently by throwing in a stone. I ended up loosing and wondering how I could have killed the invasion (and feeling cheated somehow!)
item.content:encoded:
Brilliant! ðŸ™‚
I remember one of my first games, “after” the game was played and all my territory was secure and I was clearly leading my opponent started to invade on the second line on the side. He created a number of false eyes but I didn’t realise I could make them false permanently by throwing in a stone. I ended up loosing and wondering how I could have killed the invasion (and feeling cheated somehow!)
